Articles.Content:
There's so many krakens now, none of them are hardly even worthy of being here. Honestly, only the krakens that are known for destroying the users ship and/or save should stay here along with all of the classic ones, but most of these are just random bugs that add a slight inconvenience and only have 2 sentences about them. Most of these aren't very well documented either, with the exception of ass kraken, hell kraken, gyro kraken and map kraken.

Also here's a link for convenience: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Deep_Space_Kraken

If I can get permission from a wiki admin, I'll start removing most of the ones myself that have just about no info on them and don't hardly affect the player.

Edited October 22, 2016 by Clockwork13

Doesnt have the root part interdimensional iva attachment common in shunting trains or operating a push pull service

(IVA follows the root part staying constantly on same axis)

From 0.23 to 1.2

1. Don't bump your posts.  It's against the rules.

2. There are no wiki admins here. So don't count on getting permission from them.

3. It's a wiki.  Post on the wiki discussion page about issues with the wiki.

"ass kracken" Best.. typo.. ever.

edit: Wait, what it actually says that! Lmao I thought you were trying to say sas XD

Edited October 23, 2016 by Motokid600

14 hours ago, Alshain said:

1. Don't bump your posts.  It's against the rules.

Uhm no it's not...

2 hours ago, Clockwork13 said:

Uhm no it's not...

Yes. It is. Please dont. So too is "backseat moderating". If you see a problem, please just report the post and let moderators handle it. That way we're not dragging threads off topic.  On that note some off topic posts have been removed.

18 hours ago, Alshain said:

2. There are no wiki admins here. So don't count on getting permission from them.

Paging @UmbralRaptor
Yay... I have a question about the wiki...

I've never seen a thread go nuclear so quickly.  This is both amazing and entertaining!! 

It does though make a good point regarding administration of the wiki and the where/who/when surrounding it. 

Then again, the actual 'squad produced' documentation of the game has never been complete so one should best not expect the wiki to be completely accurate either. But frankly, it's not a deal breaker...

@adsii1970 I love your avatar when viewed alongside your post in this thread. 

Oh... and that 'ass' kraken... huh?

Edited October 24, 2016 by Wallygator
The krak in my...

Yes, I do agree that calling every new glitch a "Kraken" is kinda dumb.

There is but one Kraken, the true Kraken. It is eternal and inescapable, always watching and waiting in the infinite void. Krakensbane can only delay it, and no amount of bugfixing will get rid of it for good, for the Kraken is bigger than just KSP.
The Kraken is known by many names across many video games, including the crappy one known as "real life:" Quantum Foam, False Vacuum, The Great Galactic Ghoul... but all of these in all their variety nevertheless refer to the same thing - the thing that waits in the dark, sometimes for eons, only to strike when least expected and with merciless violence, thereafter to disappear once again leaving nothing behind but debris and fear.

53 minutes ago, parameciumkid said:

Yes, I do agree that calling every new glitch a "Kraken" is kinda dumb.

There is but one Kraken, the true Kraken. It is eternal and inescapable, always watching and waiting in the infinite void. Krakensbane can only delay it, and no amount of bugfixing will get rid of it for good, for the Kraken is bigger than just KSP.
The Kraken is known by many names across many video games, including the crappy one known as "real life:" Quantum Foam, False Vacuum, The Great Galactic Ghoul... but all of these in all their variety nevertheless refer to the same thing - the thing that waits in the dark, sometimes for eons, only to strike when least expected and with merciless violence, thereafter to disappear once again leaving nothing behind but debris and fear.

All hail the power of the Kraken ... for it never sleeps and is ever vigilant
